page.title: 03THE RIVER MERSEY
page.content: The River Mersey is the natural waterway through the town. It was made navigable to Manchester in 1721, but travel along the river was always difficult and canals were more important when the region became industrialised. The Bridgewater and Manchester Ship were important canals which connected Manchester with the Mersey below Warrington and passed close to the town. In recent years, the construction of the M6 and M62 Motorways has reduced traffic on the roads, railways and canals of the town.
